#Text=Jody Turner
#Text=Futurist Jody Turner
#Text=Jody Turner

#Text=is a U.S. West Coast-based entrepreneur and futurist known for her international brand anthropology insight [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] and trend futurism research , writing [ 4 ] and keynote presenting . [ 5 ] [ 6 ]
#Text=Biography
#Text=Born in the U.S. and raised in part overseas , Turner settled on the West Coast ( USA ) as a young adult .
#Text=Turner received a Liberal Arts degree from The Evergreen State College [ 7 ]
#Text=Olympia , Washington , a self-generating curriculum school , where her studies centered on the understanding of current-to-future human endeavors in design and culture .
#Text=Career

#Text=Turner began her professional career as a visual communications designer , working 15 years+ from San Francisco to New York City , including tenure as communications designer with Nike ’s trend resource team .

#Text=Subsequent design and trend insight work included consulting with Starbucks international retail brand teams and a full-time role instigating a trend library for The Gap/Old Navy with Ivy Ross .
#Text=In 2003 , Turner met Reinier Evers [ 8 ] of Trendwatching.com at a round table in France , and cites this encounter as critical to launching her career as a trend hunter futurist . [ 9 ]
#Text=That same year Turner founded her company Culture of Future ( CoF ) .
#Text=Turner speaks at international conferences across the Americas , Europe , [ 10 ] the Middle East , Australia , [ 11 ] and within developing nations .
#Text=She is a regular speaker at the Sustainable Brands Conference in Istanbul .

#Text=In 2009 she was awarded a World Brand Congress Brand Leadership Award in Mumbai [ 12 ] and has worked on numerous global projects focused on empowering women and girls , including the Nike Foundation Girl Effect [ 13 ] out of London , and the Forbes Girl Quake project with Denise Restauri . [ 14 ]
#Text=In 2010 , Turner mentored then- Creative Studies design student Veronika Scott , and assisted her in the founding of American humanitarian project the Empowerment Plan .

#Text=The organization provides employment and training to homeless women as they hand-make sleeping-bag coats distributed to the homeless of Detroit , as well as globally via disaster relief programs .
#Text=Turner is a strategic insights writer for Fast Company Magazine , [ 15 ] the Stanford Social Innovation Review , [ 16 ] GOOD Magazine [ 17 ] and Shareable.net . [ 18 ]
#Text=Publications
#Text=In April 2019
#Text=Turner published a global insight trend report entitled " Glimpse : Understanding the Future Marketplace " that summarizes her findings as a cross-generational global trendwatcher . [ 19 ]
#Text=Boards & Associations
#Text=Jody Turner is an adjunct and rotating professor and faculty member at Pacific Northwest College of Art ( PNCA ) in the MFA in Collaborative Design graduate program . [ 20 ]
#Text=Content curator for the San Francisco impact entrepreneur and investor conference SoCap14

#Text=Member of Advisory Board for the Empowerment Plan , a Detroit-based project aimed at easing homelessness by employing homeless women to create coats that transform into sleeping bags , distributed free of charge to those who need one .
#Text=Member of the Advisory Board for the Architecture and Design Museum ( A+D ) , Los Angeles
#Text=Former Member of the Advisory Board for Cria Global , the organization charged with creating the social legacy guidelines for the Rio 2016 Olympics .
#Text=Member of the Advisory Board for Women 2.1 Summit , Ghana , Africa
#Text=Collaborator
#Text=with Hyper Island strategic digital business leadership institution
